description: I Was initially introduced to this launcher from troubleshooting how to run Minecraft on the Steamdeck. Since then, it has been my default launcher on every device I own. This is simply the best way to play Java Edition nowadays, makes adding and managing mods so flipping easy. Kudos to the developer!

Easily the best Minecraft launcher in the market. I was so glad when I switched from Windows to Linux to find out that I can natively play Prism on Linux.

One if the best flatpak app for me. Other flatpak apps have all kinds of issus but Prism just worked like a char.

Using Fedora 40 with Plasma 6.1

After the debacle regarding PolyMC's sabotage by a dumbass rogue "anti-woke" dev and then subsequently going unmaintained, Prism Launcher takes what PolyMC was and improves Poly to make it even greater than it ever was.

Neither this launcher nor PolyMC contains malware or is compromised in any way, shape, or form. Anyone who says otherwise is doing so purely for political reasons. Feel free to read up on the controversy if you want; it's basically just a bunch of a$$holes on both sides of the aisle yelling at each other. Nothing new. I've used both launchers and they're both fine. Just use whichever one you prefer and ignore the haters.
summary: It's not compromised. Neither is PolyMC

Works well in gaming mode, runs modded minecraft fine. Haven't experienced any issues with it yet. The fact it supports downloading from Curseforge and Modrinth is good enough for me including the fact it's easy for me to share mods with my friends.

description: No complaints so far
works flawlessly out of the box
A stable, feature rich launcher which receives frequent updates.
Early impressions show that this runs great, even with more demanding modpacks for Minecraft

This launcher helped save me a lot of time installing modpacks on Linux. Since Curseforge is not support on Linux (for Minecraft), I was struggling for a while trying to figure out how to install modpacks manually, until I found out about Prism Launcher!
It replaces the default Microsoft launcher entirely, allows you to connect you Microsoft and/or Mojang account, while allowing easy access to tweak settings for all installs!
Also, there is a cat in the launcher, so immediate 5 stars from me.
I have ran into very littel problems and those were my falt
hardly works online- atrocious performance issues and rubber-banding, missing/disappearing items, etc.
this is a must have if you're trans and play minecraft
The launcher works great! No need to struggle with Java, no BS!

For Linux (Steam Deck)
Dumbass-Forced myself through installing it and it worked. no need to headache over reading tutorials and figuring out which way to do it is easier and costs less disk space, just download that from the website and click the funny buttons that look right and boom, modded minecraft. only problem i've had is that i forgot to install minecraft
gotta be a 9/10 for me
it just works perfectly fine

Setting the launcher up with a microsoft/mojang account isn't too hard and once you do you get so many features.
Multiple instances
modpack support
downloading mods packs inside the launcher its self
downloading mods inside the launcher its self 
(from both curseforge and modridth) 
updating every mod you'd downloaded with a simple "update mods" button
very lightweight, QT based. (vanilla launcher is electron)
can easily enable/disable feralgamemode
can easily change how much ram MC is allowed to use
can easily tell it whether to use your dedicated GPU or not

Overall my favorite MC launcher, I love it to death, it also has 2 cats.
summary: Very good MC launcher - I love it

description: There are a few issues, but the fact that you can install and update mods through the launcher is just incredible.

description:
Word of warning for those using the steam deck and/or external monitors. 

DO NOT unplug your monitor while using prism/minecraft. I did not do this intentionally, but doing so has bricked prism to the point that I have to uninstall/reinstall to fix it. 4 Stars since I'm not sure that's prism's fault or if minecraft itself crashed so hard it broke it. 

5/5 if you plan to never encounter this issue lol.

really good for the steam deck and otherwise. Works well and i love how much controll you have over it

terrible launcher. constantly throws a java 17 error when java 8 is selected. This can only be fixed by checking the "skip java compatibility checks" box. also, the option to use mangohud does not work, even though it is installed

It integrates really easy into KDE Plasma without looking out of place.

Downloading Modpacks, Modloaders, Mods or Minecraft Versions in general do not require you to do any witchcraft and work in the application really really well...
They even reacted really fast and gave warnings or even removed some mods to download when it came to that one hacker attack with certain Minecraft mods.

This Launcher gives you so many options to customize it to your liking in the Settings Menu it is unbelievable! There is an option for almost everything you might need.

Grouping Minecraft versions and Modloaders or Modpacks is also really inuitive and just works. (Even allowing you to have multiple Minecraft Accounts saved and quickly selected on the top right)

Mods can be also added after you completed the setup for an instance or change the Forge/Fabric/Quilt/LiteLoader version OR even the Minecraft version of that instance!

It has support to download all the Curseforge and Modrinth Mods you like in the application. Just hit apply and boom it is done.

Modpacks can also be added with ease where you can choose Modpacks from ATLauncher, Curseforge, FTB Legacy, Modrinth and Technic and download and install them as a seperate instance with just two clicks.

Prism is also very responsive and instantly reacts to your actions.

I had never seen such a good Minecraft Launcher on Linux EVER!
Best MC Launcher for Linux!

It doesn't take much to realise that the negative reviews are from hateful people. 

Run by a diverse and inclusive group, and a incredibly well maintained and extremely functional. If this program isn't working for you, the discord is super helpful and supportive. I have never had an easier time modding for this game!!
summary: I wish i could say the negative reviews are contructive..

description:
Works perfectly. Super feature rich, smooth and still well maintained(other then other MultiMC forks). Totally love the in build mod installer!
Best Minecraft Launcher tested so far.

big thx to all the devs and Maintainer to continuing the project and keeping it alive!
Basically the summary.

Does everything PolyMC does, but... nothing else more? Even the same buttons are broken between both forks... the only difference seems to be a facelift of the icons and a renaming of some buttons and menus... which is a shame. Frankly there shouldn't even have been another fork, the main version should have just been improved. Now both versions are equally broken and stagnated...
PolyMC was taken over by hackers, so this is the new one. Bad reviews are from dumbasses who shouldn't be using gnu/linux in the first place.

This isn't an identical port - PolyMC was the original fork of MultiMC, but it was forcefully overtaken by an alt-right-wing nutter dev that removed everyone else's access to its source code, so the removed developers forked the last Poly update pre-takeover into this new project. (P.S. don't use PolyMC, it's said to contain malware now)
perfect buut ad wherd if mld not suppprted let us add it amyway

Super stable, lightweight and quick, with lots of customization options. Doesn't look to bad after themeing! Also maintained by a great community.

This is my main launcher on every platform that isn't arm.
I use this daily, this is now outranking PolyMC by quite a bit, better than the normal MC launcher by a long shot.
Really makes it simple to load up Minecraft on the Steam Deck, while offering easy mod support and launch commands and profiles.
It has full support for packwiz modpacks, a mod downloader, and much more! What more could you ask for?
summary: One of the best MC launchers out there

Хороший лаунчер. Невольно вспоминается MultiMC, где пиратам играть возможности не дали... Это не минус, хотя для кого-то такой расклад будет фатальным. В остальном для линукса хорошее приложение, аналоги честно говоря перечислить не смогу, кроме разве что официальных лончеров? Функциональность этого лаунчера как раз на уровне MultiMC, добавление сборок/последующая модификация их. Если вы планируете создавать свои билды грубо говоря - то это приложение для вас. Интуитивно понятный интерфейс.
